meanings.sent1: The artist carefully reengraved the metal plate to fix the mistake.
meanings.sent2: She reengraved her initials on the locket to make them stand out more.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel comically reengraved its name on the tree trunk multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The memories were deeply reengraved in her mind, impossible to forget.
meanings.sent5: The ancient symbol was reengraved on the stone tablet for preservation.

meanings.definition: To carve or cut a design or inscription again
meanings.sent1: He decided to reengrave the message on the trophy for clarity.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler had to reengrave the wedding band with a new date.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to reengrave its name on the scratched furniture.
meanings.sent4: The words of wisdom were reengraved in his heart, guiding his actions.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was reengraved to reveal hidden details.

meanings.definition: To inscribe or mark with a tool again
meanings.sent1: She had to reengrave the award plaque with the correct spelling.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman carefully reengraved the intricate pattern on the sword.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to reengrave their name on the forbidden cookie jar.
meanings.sent4: The promise was reengraved in stone, a lasting testament to their bond.
meanings.sent5: The ancient hieroglyphs were reengraved to reveal their true meaning.
